channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: TikTok finalizes deal to form new American entity
item.description: TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States that has been in discussion for years.
item.content:encoded:
TikTok has finalized a deal to create a new American entity, avoiding the looming threat of a ban in the United States that has been in discussion for years.

(Image credit: Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Republican-led House blocks effort to limit President Trump's war powers in Venezuela
item.description: Two Republicans joined Democrats to vote for the war powers resolution, but the motion failed in a 215-215 vote.
item.content:encoded:
Two Republicans joined Democrats to vote for the war powers resolution, but the motion failed in a 215-215 vote.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: House approves spending bills despite many Democrats' objections to ICE funds
item.description: The House has approved the final set of spending bills to avoid a government shutdown, despite objections from Democrats to the funding levels set for Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
The House has approved the final set of spending bills to avoid a government shutdown, despite objections from Democrats to the funding levels set for Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

(Image credit: Zayrha Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Jazz centennials: Eight legends born in 1926
item.description: In 1926, a generation of artists was born that reshaped jazz for decades. This episode celebrates eight centennials, including Miles Davis, John Coltrane, Lou Donaldson, Tony Bennett and more.
item.content:encoded: In 1926, a generation of artists was born that reshaped jazz for decades. This episode celebrates eight centennials, including Miles Davis, John Coltrane, Lou Donaldson, Tony Bennett and more.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Geledi

item.title: Anti-ICE protest at Minnesota church leads to 3 arrests but no charges for a journalist
item.description: A prominent civil rights attorney and at least two other people involved in a protest that disrupted a church service have been arrested, Trump administration officials said, even as a judge rebuffed related charges against journalist Don Lemon.
item.content:encoded:
A prominent civil rights attorney and at least two other people involved in a protest that disrupted a church service have been arrested, Trump administration officials said, even as a judge rebuffed related charges against journalist Don Lemon.

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump sues JPMorgan Chase and CEO Jamie Dimon for $5B over alleged 'debanking'
item.description: The lawsuit escalates a series of confrontations between the president and the leader of the country's biggest bank.
item.content:encoded:
The lawsuit escalates a series of confrontations between the president and the leader of the country's biggest bank.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Heart disease deaths declined. And here's how to reduce your risk of the #1 killer
item.description: An annual report from the American Heart Association shows deaths from heart disease and stroke are down, encouraging news after the rate went up in the early years of the pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
An annual report from the American Heart Association shows deaths from heart disease and stroke are down, encouraging news after the rate went up in the early years of the pandemic.

(Image credit: Kena Betancur)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Trump signs Board of Peace charter at Davos as allies split on Gaza plan
item.description: The signing ceremony marked the most concrete step yet in Trump's effort to establish the board, whose final composition has yet to be confirmed.
item.content:encoded:
The signing ceremony marked the most concrete step yet in Trump's effort to establish the board, whose final composition has yet to be confirmed.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: A vast Syrian camp for ISIS families faces an uncertain fate after a security handover
item.description: The huge al-Hol camp in northeastern Syria for years has posed an intractable problem — a destitute and increasingly dangerous detention site where ISIS ideology lives on.
item.content:encoded:
The huge al-Hol camp in northeastern Syria for years has posed an intractable problem — a destitute and increasingly dangerous detention site where ISIS ideology lives on.

(Image credit: Omar Haj Kadour)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Can the prescription drug leucovorin treat autism? History says, probably not
item.description: Parents of autistic children are clamoring for a prescription vitamin promoted by federal health officials. But there's little evidence the drug will help.
item.content:encoded:
Parents of autistic children are clamoring for a prescription vitamin promoted by federal health officials. But there's little evidence the drug will help.

(Image credit: Inna Kot/iStock)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton
